title: Infinite loading with fetch using force-cache

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue was opened via the bug report template.

body:
### Link to the code that reproduces this issue

https://github.com/crazyfrequency/next-fetch-error

### To Reproduce

1. Open the example and run it in dev.
2. Verify that nothing is running on port 8000.
3. Open http://localhost:3000/123 in the browser.

### Current vs. Expected behavior

An error is expected in both places, not just one. Or return a 500 page.

Currently, everything works fine if `fetch` is used only in either `Page` or `generateMetadata`. But when both are used together, an error occurs.

### Provide environment information

```bash
Operating System:
  Platform: linux
  Arch: x64
  Version: #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Fri Dec 27 17:05:33 UTC 2024
  Available memory (MB): 15311
  Available CPU cores: 12

Relevant Packages:
  next: 15.1.1-canary.27 // Latest available version is detected (15.1.1-canary.27).
  eslint-config-next: N/A
  react: 19.0.0
  react-dom: 19.0.0
  typescript: 5.6.2
Next.js Config:
  output: N/A
```


### Which area(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

Not sure

### Which stage(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

next dev (local), next start (local)

### Additional context

When a request is made to an unreachable or nonexistent host, one fetch throws an error, while the other hangs indefinitely. Removing the try-catch block does not change the situation.
